intro: Cynorkis amabilis, commonly known as the sweet senna, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. The seeds are enclosed in slender, elongated pods and are adapted for dispersal by wind or animals.
